title: Ticket #2582: Document QUEUE_SUPER_USERS macro
description:
The QUEUE_SUPER_USERS macro is not defined in the manual from what I can see. It should be discussed in the security section.

In the documentation about WRITE level authorization in the schedd, the following is mentioned:

  The commands which write information into the job queue (such as condor_submit and condor_hold). Note that for most commands which attempt to write to the job queue, Condor will perform an additional user-level authentication step. This additional user-level authentication prevents, for example, an ordinary user from removing a different user's jobs.

I believe this is referring to the QUEUE_SUPER_USERS mechanism, but I can't find a clear description anywhere else.

I would note that the QUEUE_SUPER_USERS mechanism is completely unlike the rest of the authorization mechanisms - it's based on the user name, not the domain name or the originating address. This breaks the security scheme at our site, where we make a distinction between daemons (foo@daemon.unl.edu) and site users (username@unl.edu).
